meaning: Is, am, or are (used to describe a state of being or identity).
example: 私（わたし）はマイク です。 (I am Mike.)

meaning: Too, and, or also (used to add something or someone to a previous statement).
example: 彼（かれ）はサッカーが好き（すき）です。私（わたし） も サッカーが好き（すき）です。 (He likes soccer. I like soccer, too.)

meaning: At or in (used to specify the location where an action takes place).
example: エミは学校（がっこう） で数学（すうがく）を勉強（べんきょう）します。 (Emi studies math at school.)

meaning: To (used to indicate a destination or direction, such as location or action destination).
example: リエ子はローマ に行き（いき）ました。 (Rieko went to Rome.)

meaning: A general preposition that can mean in, at, to, for, etc., depending on context.
example: この本（ほん）をあの人（ひと） に 上げ（あげ）てください。 (Please give the book to that person.)

meaning: Denotes the object of an action (direct object marker).
example: あの猫（ねこ）は魚（さかな） を食べ（たべ）た。 (That cat ate the fish.)

meaning: Won't you ~ ? or Shall we ~ ? (used for invitations).
example: ケーキを食べ（たべ） ませんか？ (Won't you have some cake?)

meaning: Denotes a topic (marks the topic of the sentence).
example: 彼女（かのじょ） は嬉しい（うれしい）です。 (She is happy.)

meaning: There is (used for non-living things).
example: つくえの上（うえ）にボール があります。 (There is a ball on the desk.)

meaning: There is or is (used for living things or things that appear alive, like ghosts or robots).
example: あそこの木（き）の下（した）に、二人（ふたり）子供（こども） がいます。 (There are two children under the tree over there.)

meaning: Links nouns in a complete list.
example: そのサラダはレタス と にんじん と ラディッシュから 作り（つくり）ました。 (The salad was made from lettuce, carrot, and radish.)

meaning: Polite volitional phrase, meaning I'll or let's (expressing intention or suggestion).
example: 食べ（たべ） ましょう。 (Let's eat!)

meaning: Polite volitional phrase used for suggestions, meaning How about we ~ ?
example: 食べ（たべ） ましょうか。 (How about we eat?)

meaning: Used to make a request by linking a verb in its te-form to ください (please).
example: 日本語（にほんご）で話し（はなし） て下さい（ください）。 (Please speak in Japanese.)

meaning: It's okay to ~ or May I ~ ? (used to ask for or grant permission).
example: 料理（りょうり）し てもいいですか。 (May I cook?)

meaning: Must not ~ or It's not good to ~ (used to prohibit or disapprove).
example: サーラーの手書き（てがき） はよくありません（いけません）。 (Sarah's handwriting is not great.)

meaning: From (indicates a starting point).
example: この電車（でんしゃ）はサンホセ からサンフランシスコにいきます。 (This train goes from San Jose to San Francisco.)

meaning: Indicates an ongoing action (progressive tense, like ing in English) or a resulting state.
example: 私（わたし）は読ん（よん） でいます。 (I am reading.)

meaning: To go somewhere or to go do something (used after a verb stem).
example: 私（わたし）は泳ぎ（およぎ） に行く。 (I go swimming.)

meaning: Please don't ~ (used to politely request someone not to do something).
example: この林檎（りんご）を食べ（たべ） ないでください。 (Please don't eat this apple.)

meaning: Like to do something (expresses liking an activity).
example: 私（わたし）はアニメを見る（みる） のが好き（すき）です。 (I like watching anime.)

meaning: Is good at something (describes proficiency in an activity).
example: 彼女（かのじょ）は歌う（うたう） のが上手（じょうず）です。 (She's good at singing.)

meaning: Is bad at something (describes lack of proficiency in an activity).
example: 私（わたし）は踊る（おどる） のが下手（へた）です。 (I'm bad at dancing.)

meaning: Hasn't done something yet (indicates something is not yet completed).
example: 私（わたし）は まだ決め（きめ） ていません。 (I haven't decided yet.)

meaning: Is more ~ than (compares two things, stating one is better, more expensive, etc.).
example: この本（ほん） の方（ほう）が あの新聞（しんぶん） より高い（たかい）。 (This book is more expensive than that newspaper.)

meaning: The most ~ or the best among (identifies the best or most of something in a group).
example: あの図書館（としょかん） の中（なか）でこの本（ほん） がいちばん。 (This book is the best in that library.)

meaning: Plan to or intend to (expresses a future intention or plan).
example: 私（わたし）は映画（えいが）を 見（み）に行く（いく） つもりです。 (I'm going to go see a movie.)

meaning: To become ~ (describes a change in state, with different forms for -i and -na adjectives).
example: あの女性（じょせい）はきれい になった。 (That woman became beautiful.)

meaning: Want to do (polite form of expressing desire to perform an action).
example: 僕（ぼく）はケーキを食べ（たべ） たいです。 (I want to eat some cake.)

meaning: Do this and that or sometimes this and sometimes that (lists activities or attributes).
example: 昨日（きのう）私（わたし）は本（ほん）を読ん（よん） だりお菓子（おかし）を食べ（たべ） たりした。 (Yesterday I was reading a book and eating sweets.)

meaning: Have done or have experienced (indicates past experience).
example: 私（わたし）は東京（とうきょう）へ行っ たことがある。 (I've been to Tokyo.)

meaning: Links nouns in an incomplete list (implies and others).
example: 猫（ねこ） や犬（いぬ） や猿（さる）が動物園（どうぶつえん）にいます。 (There are cats, dogs, monkeys, and others at the zoo.)

meaning: Emphasizes or softens a statement, request, or order (adds explanation or clarification).
example: 私（わたし）は今（いま）忙しい（いそがしい） んです。 (I'm busy right now.)

meaning: Too much or too ~ (indicates excess).
example: 山田（やまだ）さんは食べ（たべ） すぎる。 (Mr. Yamada eats too much.)

meaning: It's better to ~ or should ~ (gives advice or recommendation).
example: 貴方（あなた）はこの本（ほん）を買っ（かっ）た ほうがいい。 (You should buy this book.)

meaning: Because or so (explains a reason, more impartial than から).
example: この本（ほん）は高い（たかい） ので買わ（かわ）ない。 (I'm not buying this book because it's expensive.)

meaning: Have to ~ or must ~ (indicates necessity).
example: 貴方（あなた）は宿題（しゅくだい）を終わら（おわら） なくちゃいけない。 (You have to finish your homework.)

meaning: Isn't it? or right? (seeks confirmation or expresses uncertainty).
example: 貴方（あなた）は七（しち）時（じ）まえに帰る（かえる） でしょう？ (You'll come back before 7 o'clock, right?)

meaning: Before doing ~ or ago (indicates time before an action or event).
example: 食べる（たべる） 前（まえ）に手（て）を洗っ（あらっ）て下さい（ください）。 (Please wash your hands before eating.)

meaning: After doing ~ (indicates doing something after another action).
example: 考え（かんがえ） てから言って（いって）ください。 (Please speak after thinking.)

meaning: Used to list reasons for multiple states or actions (similar to 'and' or 'because').
example: 優しい（やさしい）し、格好いい（かっこいい）し、面白い（おもしろい）から。 (Because he's kind, attractive, and interesting [among other things].)

meaning: 'It seems like' or 'appears to be.'
example: 明日（あした）雪（ゆき）が降り（ふり）そうです。 (Tomorrow it looks like it will snow.)

meaning: 'To try to do something.'
example: 彼（かれ）は彼女（かのじょ）と話し（はなし）てみる。 (He'll try to talk to her.)

meaning: Implies that the action before なら happens after the action following it in time (opposite of たら).
example: 友達（ともだち）が来る（くる）なら、私（わたし）はピザを注文（ちゅうもん）する。 (If our friends come, I will order pizza [first].)

meaning: A particle used to link a period of time with how often something happens.
example: 一週（いっしゅ）間（かん）に一回（いっかい）日本語（にほんご）を勉強し（べんきょうし）ます。 (I study Japanese once a week.)

meaning: 'To want something' (literally 'something is wanted').
example: 私（わたし）はこの本（ほん）が欲しい（ほしい）。 (I want this book.)

meaning: Used to observe someone else's feelings or desires (e.g., what they want or feel).
example: 家（うち）に帰っ（かえっ）たら、すぐパソコンを使い（つかい）たがる。 (It seems like [they] want to use the computer as soon as [they] get home.)

meaning: Indicates possibility ('maybe' or 'might').
example: 明日（あした）は雨（あめ）が降る（ふる）かもしれない。 (It may rain tomorrow.)

meaning: Used for giving advice or suggestions ('How about...?' or 'Why don’t you...?').
example: 薬（くすり）を飲ん（のん）だらどうですか？ (How about taking some medicine?)

meaning: 'As many as' (emphasizes quantity).
example: 昨日（きのう）、電話（でんわ）三（さん）回（かい）もしたよ！ (I called you like three times yesterday!)

meaning: 'Only' or 'as few as' (implies limitation, used with negative verbs).
example: 彼（かれ）にはお金（おかね）しかない。 (He has nothing but money.)

meaning: 'To do something in advance' (for future convenience or preparation).
example: この分（ぶん）を覚え（おぼえ）ておく。 (I'll memorize this part [because it may appear on a test].)

meaning: 'Let’s do (something)' (used with ichidan verbs).
example: このケーキを食べ（たべ）よう。 (Let’s eat this cake.)

meaning: 'Let’s do (something)' (used with godan verbs).
example: あそこで遊（あそ）ぼう。 (Let’s play over there.)

meaning: 'A does something for B' (A helps or gives an action to B).
example: 私（わたし）は山田（やまだ）さんに本（ほん）を買っ（かっ）てあげました。 (I bought this book for Yamada-san.)

meaning: 'Someone does something for me' (receiver is the speaker).
example: 山田（やまだ）さんは私（わたし）に本（ほん）を買っ（かっ）てくれました。 (Yamada-san bought this book for me.)

meaning: 'To get someone to do something' (asking or making someone do something for you).
example: 彼（かれ）に宿題（しゅくだい）を見せ（みせ）てもらう。 (I’ll make him show his homework.)

meaning: Polite request or asking for permission ('Could you...?' or 'Would you...?').
example: 窓（まど）を開け（あけ）ていただけませんか。 (Could you open the window?)

meaning: 'I hope...' or 'It would be nice if...'
example: 明日（あした）いい天気（てんき）だといいですね。 (I hope the weather tomorrow is good.)

meaning: Apologize for something done ('I’m sorry for doing...').
example: 汚い（きたない）言葉（ことば）を使っ（つかっ）てすみませんでした。 (I’m sorry for using bad language.)

meaning: 'It seems' or 'appears' (used after verb stems, nouns, or adjectives).
example: 彼（かれ）はケーキを食べ（たべ）そうです。 (It seems he eats cake.)

meaning: 'To let someone do something' or 'to make someone do something.'
example: この音（おと）が私（わたし）をいらいらさせる。 (This sound irritates me.)

meaning: Used for giving orders or commands politely.
example: 学校（がっこう）へ行き（いき）なさい。 (Go to school!)

meaning: 'If (something happens).'
example: この果物（くだもの）を食べ（たべ）ればすぐに元気（げんき）になる。 (If you eat this fruit, you’ll recover soon.)

meaning: 'Even if' or 'even though.'
example: 全部（ぜんぶ）食べ（たべ）てもいいよ。 (You can go ahead and eat it all.)

meaning: Conditional 'if' (if A happens, then B will happen).
example: 日本（にほん）に行っ（いっ）たら、着物（きもの）を買い（かい）ます。 (I will buy a kimono if I go to Japan.)

meaning: 'Don’t have to do' or 'it’s fine not to do.'
example: 君（きみ）は今日（きょう）学校（がっこう）へ行か（いか）なくてもいい。 (You don’t have to go to school today.)

meaning: 'Seems to be' (e.g., difficult, deep, etc.).
example: この本（ほん）は難しい（むずかしい）みたい。 (This book seems to be difficult.)

meaning: 'To end up doing something' (often unintentionally).
example: 私（わたし）はけっきょく学校（がっこう）へ行っ（いっ）てしまう。 (After all, I’ll end up going to school.)

meaning: 'If A, then B' (for situations that can’t be controlled).
example: もし貴方（あなた）がこのケーキを食べる（たべる）と私（わたし）は怒る（おこる）だろう！ (If you eat this cake, I will be angry!)

meaning: Indicates two actions happening simultaneously ('while doing').
example: 男の子（おとこのこ）はケーキを食べ（たべ）ながらコーヒーを飲ん（のん）だ。 (The boy drank coffee while he ate cake.)

meaning: 'I wish I had done' or 'should have done.'
example: 学生（がくせい）のとき、勉強（べんきょう）すれば良かった（よかった）です。 (I should have studied when I was a student.)

meaning: 'Thank you for doing.'
example: 手伝っ（てつだっ）てくれてありがとう。 (Thank you for your help.)

meaning: 'I’m glad I could do' or 'it was good to do.'
example: 駅（えき）で久しぶり（ひさしぶり）に友達（ともだち）と会え（あえ）てよかった。 (I’m glad I could meet my friend at the station after a long time.)

meaning: 'Should be' or 'supposed to be.'
example: それはこれまでに終わった（をわった）はずです。 (It should have ended by now.)

meaning: 'Don’t do (something)' (can be made polite with ください).
example: このケーキを食べ（たべ）ないで。 (Don’t eat this cake.)

meaning: Used in yes/no questions to indicate uncertainty ('whether or not').
example: 田中（たなか）さんは、明日（あした）来る（くる）かどうか、分かり（わかり）ますか？ (Do you know whether Tanaka-san is coming tomorrow or not?)

meaning: 'Called,' 'such as,' or 'that.'
example: クレヨンしんちゃんという漫画（まんが）は面白い（おもしろい）ですよ。 (A comic called Crayon Shinchan is really interesting.)

meaning: Indicates that an action is easy (conjugates like an い-adjective).
example: 水（みず）は飲み（のみ）やすいです。 (Drinking water is easy.)

meaning: Indicates that an action is hard to do (opposite of ～やすい).
example: この字（じ）は読み（よみ）にくい。 (This handwriting is hard to read.)

meaning: Forms passive verbs ('to be done' or 'to be affected').
example: 水（みず）が子供（こども）に飲ま（のま）れました。 (The water was drunk by the child.)

meaning: Indicates something is in a state of completion ('has been done').
example: 準備（じゅんび）は、もうしてあるよ。 (The preparations are already done.)

meaning: 'While' (something happens during another action).
example: お風呂（おふろ）に入っ（はいっ）ている間に、電話（でんわ）がありました。 (There was a phone call while I was taking a bath.)

meaning: To change the state or condition of something ('to make' or 'to become').
example: きれいにする (To make [something] pretty or clean.)

meaning: 'I want (someone) to do (something).'
example: 父（ちち）にたばこを止め（やめ）てほしいです。 (I want my father to stop smoking.)

meaning: 'Even though,' 'despite,' or 'albeit.'
example: 私（わたし）は宿題（しゅくだい）を終えた（おえた）のにまだ寝られ（ねられ）ない。 (Even though I’ve finished my homework, I can’t go to sleep yet.)

meaning: Describes something as similar to a noun ('like' or 'such as').
example: スージーは私（わたし）のお母（おかあ）さんのようなものだ。 (Susie seems like my mother.)

meaning: 'Like' or 'similar to' (used to compare actions or states).
example: ピカピカの太陽（たいよう）のように。 (Shining like the sun.)

meaning: 'To be made to do' (causative passive, forced to do something).
example: 母（はは）に勉強（べんきょう）[を]させられる。 (I am forced to study by my mother.)

meaning: 'To decide to do (something).'
example: 彼（かれ）は勉強（べんきょう）することにする。 (He’s deciding to study.)

meaning: For the purpose of ～; in order to ～. Gives the goal.
example: 日本語を学ぶために留学しに来ました。 (I came to study abroad in order to learn Japanese.)

meaning: Depending on ～
example: 曜日によってランチメニューが違います。 (Depending on the day of the week, the lunch menu is different.)

meaning: The more ～, the more ～
example: 地震が強ければ強いほど、津波が起こる可能性が高くなります。 (The stronger an earthquake, the higher the probability for a tsunami to occur.)

meaning: If only
example: 時間さえあれば、もっと日本語を勉強できます。 (If only I had more time, I could study more Japanese.)

meaning: If (hypothetically) ～; in the case that ～
example: 車を購入したらどれが欲しいですか？ (If you were to buy a car, which would you want?)

meaning: Just ～; freshly ～
example: 焼きたてのパンがフワフワで美味しいね。 (Freshly baked bread is soft and delicious.)

meaning: Like ～; ～-ish; with ～ character
example: わがままで図々しい言い方は子供っぽい。 (That selfish and impudent way of speaking is childish.)

meaning: Pretend to ～
example: 友達とメールしていたのに、上司が怒らないように仕事をしているふりにした。 (Although I was emailing my friend, I pretended to be working so my boss wouldn't get angry.)

meaning: Thanks to ～; because of ～
example: 先生のおかげでN3を合格しました。 (I passed the N3 thanks to my teacher.)

meaning: A change which has taken place or will take place
example: 最近、日本語が上手に話せるようになりました。 (Recently, I have become able to speak Japanese well.)

meaning: To be decided; to be arranged
example: 明日は会議があることになりました。 (It has been decided that there will be a meeting tomorrow.)

meaning: Can't possibly
example: そんなに忙しいとてもではない。 (It can't possibly be that busy.)

meaning: Seems like; hearsay
example: 彼は有名人らしいです。 (I heard he is a celebrity.)

meaning: Without doing ～
example: 説明しないで、急に行動しないでください。 (Please don't act suddenly without explaining.)

meaning: Like ～
example: 彼女は母のような人です。 (She is like a mother.)

meaning: Nothing but ～
example: 彼はゲームばかりしています。 (He does nothing but play games.)

meaning: ~ A is famous for B
example: 京都は寺で有名です。 (Kyoto is famous for its temples.)

meaning: For example; starting with
example: 東京を始め、日本の都市は美しいです。 (Starting with Tokyo, Japanese cities are beautiful.)

meaning: (How much) ~ (adj) is ~
example: この本は難しいくらいです。 (This book is quite difficult.)

meaning: To the extent
example: 彼は疲れているほどです。 (He is tired to such an extent.)

meaning: In its current state
example: 部屋は散らかったままです。 (The room remains messy.)

meaning: To bother oneself to do something
example: わざわざ来てくれてありがとう。 (Thank you for taking the trouble to come.)

meaning: This used to ~ / This was what ~
example: 昔はよく遊んだものだ。 (We used to play a lot in the past.)

meaning: About/around ~
example: 1000円ぐらいです。 (It’s about 1000 yen.)

meaning: On the contrary
example: 忙しいかえって、集中力が上がる。 (On the contrary, being busy increases my focus.)

meaning: There is ~ in ~
example: 彼には優しさがある。 (There is kindness in him.)

meaning: In relation to ~
example: その問題に関する報告書です。 (It’s a report regarding that issue.)

meaning: Impossible!
example: まさか、彼が来るなんて！ (No way, he actually came!)

meaning: Probably won't
example: 雨が降るまい。 (It probably won’t rain.)

meaning: Just, for good
example: その日以来、会ったきりです。 (Since that day, we haven’t met again.)

meaning: What in the world?
example: いったいどうしたんですか？ (What in the world happened?)

meaning: I think that ~
example: どうやら、彼は来ないようです。 (It seems he won’t come.)

meaning: Furthermore
example: さらに、問題が起きました。 (Furthermore, a problem arose.)

meaning: Already ~
example: すでに、仕事が終わりました。 (The work is already finished.)

meaning: Without thinking
example: つい、遅刻してしまった。 (I ended up being late without thinking.)

meaning: Rather; better; instead
example: むしろ、早く行きましょう。 (Rather, let’s go early.)

meaning: Even; if only; if just; as long as; the only thing needed
example: 時間さえあれば、できます。 (If only I had time, I could do it.)

meaning: Get used to ~ ; come to be ~
example: 新しい環境になれるまで時間がかかりました。 (It took time to get used to the new environment.)

meaning: There is no doubt that ~, I am sure that ~
example: 彼が来るに違いない。 (I’m sure he will come.)

meaning: Considerably
example: なかなか難しい問題です。 (It’s a considerably difficult problem.)

meaning: Without doing ~ (shortened form of ~ないで)
example: 説明せずに、急に行動しないでください。 (Please don’t act suddenly without explaining.)

meaning: According to, due to, by means of
example: 新聞によると、明日は雨です。 (According to the newspaper, it will rain tomorrow.)

meaning: In place of ~
example: 彼の代わりに、私が行きます。 (I will go in his place.)

meaning: Make sure to do ~
example: 遅れないようにします。 (I’ll make sure not to be late.)

meaning: To start to ~
example: 新しい仕事を始めました。 (I started a new job.)

meaning: Even if~
example: 忙しくても、頑張ります。 (Even if I’m busy, I’ll do my best.)

meaning: As ~, in the role of ~
example: 学生として、勉強しなければなりません。 (As a student, I must study.)

meaning: In order that ~
example: 成功するように頑張ります。 (I’ll work hard to succeed.)

meaning: (Emphasis)
example: 今こそ、行動する時です。 (Now is the time to act.)

meaning: Before ~ happens (before it rains, ~)
example: 雨が降る前に、家に帰りましょう。 (Let’s go home before it rains.)

meaning: By all means, at any rate
example: どうしても、行きたいです。 (I really want to go.)

meaning: Tends to be ~
example: 彼は遅刻がちです。 (He tends to be late.)

meaning: As far as possible, at the most
example: せいぜい、頑張ってください。 (Do your best as much as possible.)

meaning: Nothing better than ~
example: この店に限ります。 (There’s nothing better than this shop.)

meaning: As well as; with; along with; at the same time
example: 彼とともに、行きます。 (I’ll go along with him.)

meaning: ~ whenever ~
example: 彼に会うたびに、話します。 (Whenever I meet him, we talk.)

meaning: Merely ~ ; no more than ~
example: それは単なる勘違いすぎない。 (It’s merely a misunderstanding.)

meaning: As for ~ ; regarding ~
example: 彼のことおいて、心配しています。 (Regarding him, I’m worried.)

meaning: Seems like~
example: 彼は疲れげです。 (He seems tired.)

meaning: Having the intention of~
example: 勉強するつもりでいます。 (I intend to study.)

meaning: Only after ～; it was not until ～
example: 入院して初めて自分の健康が大切だと思っていました。 (It was not until I was hospitalized that I thought my own health was important.)
